captions.text: This city is built on being fabulous and drawing attention

Looking at Vegas from the outside you see large buildings
and people who are enjoying themselves,
shows and gambling everywhere

That's what it looks like,
but that doesn't capture the reality
This tunnel is home to many homeless people
I'm going to check it out with Matt

Las Vegas, like the rest of America,
utilizes these tunnels to prevent flooding from rain
The tunnels are well built and designed for their function

but there is another problem lurking:
the number of homeless people that seek shelter in these tunnels

He describes what he sees as a resident,
things a tourist wouldn't see

A tourist will only see the fabulous Las Vegas,
only someone who lives there will see what's hidden
He lives there, he interacts with people every day
He said, "I see fear"

The millions that people have lost here,
that is what built this city
To prove his point, we saw an airstrip for private jets
Many of these jets are owned by the hotels

They fly over multimillionaires for free,
let them stay at the hotel and provide services
all free of charge
so that they would spend large sums of money over a few nights
There are different methods used to try to suck you dry

As for the common folk, they aren't going to fly us for free
but they have other ways to encourage us to spend
All over the US ATMs have a withdrawal limit of $200
except for Las Vegas, where it's unlimited

You can withdraw $1000 in one go 
to make it more convenient for you to gamble more
Some places accept dollars, quarters or even 10 cents
So you can gamble with 10 cents? They don't care, they'll take anything
Then there's 5 cents, and also for a penny
It's a way to suck a person dry to their last cent

So what happens after a guy gambles and loses all of his money?
Will they let him go?
They will try to squeeze every last drop they can
Las Vegas has more pawn shops than any other city in America

What are pawn shops?
So you run out of money, but you have a watch, for example,
you take it to the shop and pawn in there
They value the watch, let's say for $50.
The shop will give you $50 for it

The shop takes 13% per month in interest
156% interest over a year
Exploitation
Some people end up not having enough money to go back home
so they come here to pawn

"Give us your watch, your jacket, your shoes."
They'll leave you [laughter]

In the UK, like other Western countries,
gambling is so popular that there are shops dedicated to gambling
There are more than 2000 in Britain alone
They make billions of dollars every year
Let's go in and see how they manage to attract over 73% of Brits

They made it easier for people to gamble
by allowing them to gamble on just about anything
He told me that people can now bet on which song will top the charts during Christmas
"Will Justin Beiber go to jail or not?"
There were even bets on what Prince William would call his child before he was born
I don't understand this:
They support the gambling addiction support centers
Some centers have special hotlines
So what? They attract customers and then help battle the addiction?
It's a vicious cycle
There are so many addicts he city now contains many addiction treatment centers

Behind me is Lifeworks Community 
for overcoming gambling addiction
So the people addicted to gambling have a hole in their soul so they try to fill it with gambling
This is the Hoover Dam in Las Vegas
A lot of people come here to commit suicide after they lose all of their money
There's one person who was caught on tape, which we will show
Viewer discretion is advised
The suicide rate in Las Vegas is 50% higher compared to the national average
Allah says in the Quran "Ta Ha, We have not sent down to you the Qur'an that you be distressed"
These are the verses that caused Omar Ibn alKhattab to convert to Islam
The ban on gambling isn't to harm people, it's for their happiness
Without gambling a person will be happy
But if they gamble and follow their desires they will fall to grief
"And whoever turns away from My remembrance - indeed, he will have a depressed life"
His life will be grief and hardship, and this is what we see today
This neighborhood we're in now has one of the highest rate of homeless people
and despite that, there are 8 gambling places nearby
One of which is on a church ground
When one stops gambling they shouldn't feel that they are missing out on the fun
No, they should quit while thanking Allah and should be happy to leave it
You can find happiness in avoiding what Allah has forbid us from
This happiness is thousands of times stronger than the temporary happiness from following such desires
because this is a consistent happiness, it doesn't play tricks on your conscience, or cause stress
You are living in sync with Allah's rules for this universe
Look at the desperation. This is what happens when someone reaches rock bottom
We can see the desperation that can lead to suicide
We met a woman living in the tunnels who built a house with walls and lighting
She's been living there for 5 years
Look at what politicians have to say about gambling
"Introducing gambling to our state is a terrible economic plan"
Let's look at the effect of gambling in different states
These are the states that allow gambling
Let's look at Atlantic City
Gambling was made legal there in 1978
A study shows that within 9 years the crime rate went up 107%

Within 30 miles around the city
That's 4 times the national average
They also found that around the casinos there is an increase in all types of crime
Robbery, murder, traffic accidents
Alhamdullilah that in some Islamic countries it is forbidden

Any Islamic country that forbids it, Alhamdullilah
Any Islamic country that allows it, please reconsider

Another thing
Even in some places that ban gambling there is some playing around with words
It's gambling but they don't call it that
All of those phone competitions where you pay to stay on the line in the hopes that you may win
That's gambling

In some airports they'll have a lottery for a car for example
What do you think that is?

Two days ago we filmed here with John
and I felt that he is a man who can think
So I'm going to take this opportunity to introduce him to Islam
This is a book by Karen Armstrong

It's a book about Muhammad (PBUH) written in a modern way
that Westerners can relate to

Dear John,
May God Guide you to the Straight Path
& may He grant You Peace, Wisdom, & Happiness
This is where he was, so In sha Allah he will come back here tonight
So let's leave this here
